definition[0]: a fast method of writing using special signs or shorter forms to represent letters, words, and phrases
example[0]: a secretary who takes shorthand  (=writes in shorthand)
example[1]: The reporter took notes in shorthand.
definition[1]: a shorter but less clear way of saying something
example[2]: He’s been ‘relocated’, which is shorthand for ‘given a worse job a long way away’.
example[3]: Mary was taking shorthand (=making notes in shorthand).
example[4]: Scientific jargon uses a shorthand of technical words and phrases.
example[5]: The term ‘one-parent family’ is misleading shorthand for a variety of situations.
